items.title: Soaring prices stall Dussehra gold rush, volume down 25% this year
Isabgol processors threaten to halt purchases from October 6 over GST issues
Nvidia and Fujitsu partner on AI, robots and infrastructure
items.summary:
- *Nvidia* and *Fujitsu* will build an *AI infrastructure* for Japan by 2030, combining Nvidia GPUs with Fujitsu’s local expertise.
- The partnership targets *AI robots*, digital twins and applications across health care, manufacturing and customer services, with potential collaboration with Yaskawa.
- Aim is a *humancentric* approach to ease Japan’s labor shortages and later scale solutions globally, though investment details were not disclosed.

items.title: Trump cancels billions in clean energy grants
Tharisa to invest $547M in underground platinum mine
items.summary:
- Tharisa will invest $547 million to convert its Bushveld open‑pit operation to *underground* mining over the next decade to extend its life‑of‑mine.
- The mechanised project targets first ore from one of two shafts in Q2 2026 and aims for steady‑state output of **200,000 oz** of PGMs and >2 million tonnes of chrome annually.
- The plan bets on sustained demand for *PGMs* from fuel cells and clean hydrogen despite EV pressures and complements a 226,000 oz/year Karo platinum project in Zimbabwe.

items.title: India recommends anti-dumping duty on Chinese solar cells
items.author: TOI Business Desk
items.summary:
- The Commerce Ministry's DGTR has recommended a *definitive anti-dumping duty* on imported **solar cells** from *China* for *three years* to shield domestic manufacturers.
- Suggested duties range from *23%* to *30%* of the CIF value for some Chinese firms, with the Finance Ministry to take the final decision.
- The measure aims to protect India's growing *renewable energy* supply chain and address the trade imbalance with *China*.

items.title: Govt may cancel 3-4 GW of solar tenders over import rules
items.summary:
- The government ordered clean‑energy agencies to cancel and reissue at least *3–4 GW* of solar tenders that were *rushed* to bypass the June 2026 local‑content rule.
- Agencies allegedly misused an exemption allowing bids by Aug 31, issuing some tenders with *7‑day* windows; they have *15 days* to report actions taken.
- Cancellations could delay projects, favour domestic manufacturers ahead of the policy and strain supplies until India is largely self‑sufficient by *March 2027*.

items.title: Socomec to invest $10M in new India factory
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary:
- Socomec will invest *$7–10 million* to set up a leased greenfield **factory in India**, scouting southern and western locations to expand local production.
- Already running two Gurgaon plants at full capacity, it aims to raise *Make in India* output from ~50% to 70% and target growth in **data centers**, renewables, and EV charging.
- The company invests ~8% of turnover in R&D for *high-efficiency* compact products, and is exploring acquisitions in switching/monitoring and growth in *BESS*.

items.title: India issues 3.6 GW renewables tenders; 25 GW solar added
items.author: Saurav Anand, ET EnergyWorld
items.summary:
- India floated *3,628 MW* of renewable tenders in September — including a *1,000 MW* Deendayal Port solar bid, a *600 MW* ISTS wind bid by SJVN and Coal India's *3,000 MW* multi‑state solar EPC plan.
- From January–August India added *25,264 MW* solar and *4,517 MW* wind (total renewables ~*242.6 GW*), and a 600 MW solar+storage auction at Rewa awarded *ACME* and *Ceigall* 300 MW each.
- *USD 2,245 million* of investments entered renewables in September, Green DAM traded *994 million units* (avg Rs 4.04/unit), module prices were stable and multiple policy notifications were issued.

items.title: TCS hiring, cybersecurity moves under US, UK lens
items.author: Veena Mani, TNN
items.summary:
- US Senators Grassley and Durbin pressed TCS CEO K Krithivasan over hiring after Jacksonville layoffs, noting TCS got approval for *5,505 H-1B visas* in FY2025 and faces an *EEOC* probe into alleged replacement of older American workers.
- UK MP Liam Byrne sought answers about TCS's role in cyber incidents at *Jaguar Land Rover, M&S,* and *Co-op*, citing BBC reports a ransomware email was allegedly sent using a TCS employee account.
- Combined scrutiny targets TCS's *hiring practices* and *cybersecurity controls*, posing reputational and regulatory risks across the *US* and *UK*.

items.title: India more accessible than EU, says Dutch chip company
items.summary:
- At a Brussels summit ASML executive Frank Heemskerk said *India* is more accessible than the *EU*, noting *ASML*'s CEO had a two-hour meeting with PM *Modi* that included direct feedback.
- Heemskerk added it's often easier to get a meeting with the *White House* than with a commissioner, highlighting limited access to top EU policymakers.
- He urged European leaders to *engage* with companies investing in the region to retain semiconductor investment and improve industry-government dialogue.

items.title: India will end defence dependence — Rajnath Singh
items.summary:
- Rajnath Singh said India will *no longer depend on foreign nations for defence*, citing a 97-LCA deal with >64% local content and indigenous platforms like **Tejas**.
- He noted defence exports rose from ₹600 crore to ₹24,000 crore and are forecast to reach ₹50,000 crore by 2029, stressing forces are *defensive* to protect national values.
- Singh highlighted MSME reforms and the 'Local for Global' push aiming to make India the *Factory of the World* by 2030.

items.title: "Fighters will remain relevant in future warfare," says IAF chief, countering Elon Musk's claim on drone warfare
Goodluck India to bid for DRDO's AMCA programme
items.summary:
- Goodluck India signed a tripartite MoU with *BrahMos Thiruvananthapuram* and *Axiscades* to jointly bid for DRDO's *AMCA* programme.
- AMCA aims to deliver a fifth‑generation stealth fighter with *advanced avionics*, *super‑cruise*, internal weapons bays and EW systems, aligning with *Atmanirbhar Bharat*.
- Goodluck's subsidiary received an industrial licence for medium‑calibre artillery shells and the company has six plants (500,000 tpa), bolstering indigenous defence manufacturing.

items.title: India's dairy sector grew by 70% in past 11 yrs: Amit Shah
India is much more than just a tyre market for us: Michelin's Vitor Silva
Panacea Biotec wins UNICEF order for bOPV worth ₹315 cr
items.summary:
- Panacea Biotec has received a long-term *UNICEF* contract to supply *bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV)* valued at USD 35.65M (≈₹315 crore) for 1 Apr 2026–31 Mar 2030.
- The award covers supply in *10- and 20-vial* presentations and will meet *UNICEF* orders as received during the agreement period.
- The deal strengthens *Panacea Biotec*'s role in global polio immunization and supports ongoing eradication efforts.

items.title: Adani, Reliance among six private firms exploring small modular nuclear reactors
Govt extends last date for PLI Scheme for Textiles applications till December 31
USA Rare Earth shares surge on reported White House talks
items.summary:
- USA Rare Earth shares jumped 10% premarket after CEO Barbara Humpton said the company is in *close talks with the White House* about potential support.
- The company is developing a *Sierra Blanca, Texas* mine and a neo‑magnet plant in *Stillwater, Oklahoma*, aiming for commercial output in H1 2026.
- The move follows Washington using emergency powers and stakes in miners to secure *critical minerals*; USA Rare Earth's market cap is about $2.59B and shares are up 97.8% YTD.

items.title: Finland seeks to help India's digital future look beyond Chinese tech
Inox AP starts building specialty gas hub for semiconductors in Dholera
Tharisa to invest $547M in underground platinum project
items.summary:
- *Tharisa* will invest **$547 million** over the next decade to convert its Bushveld open‑pit operations to *underground mining*, aiming to extend the life‑of‑mine.
- The mechanised underground project expects to reach steady‑state output of at least *200,000 ounces* of PGMs and over *2 million tonnes* of chrome annually, supporting technologies like fuel cells and clean hydrogen.
- The move strengthens *South Africa*'s PGM supply amid EV-driven demand uncertainty and underscores multi‑generational resource planning for the energy transition.

items.title: Multiple firms get into Li-ion cell production amid rising demand
Panasonic merges Industry & Energy; Narayan Kumar named CBO
items.summary:
- Panasonic Life Solutions India has merged its *Industrial Devices Division* and *Energy Solutions Division* into **Panasonic Industry & Energy India (PIDEIN)** to boost agility and customer synergies.
- The integration aims to *improve organisational agility*, create synergies for *customer experience*, and align with Panasonic's long‑term India strategy.
- Narayan Kumar, formerly Divisional Director of INDD, is appointed **Chief Business Officer** of PIDEIN and will report to Tadashi Chiba.

items.title: Steel Exchange India secures ₹350 crore refinancing
items.summary:
- *Steel Exchange India* secured **₹350 crore** refinancing from a consortium including *Kotak Mahindra Investments*, *Oxyzo Financial Services* and *Kotak Credit Opportunities Fund*. 
- **₹150 crore** has been disbursed to prepay high‑cost NCDs and a term loan; the remaining **₹200 crore** will be disbursed to acquire outstanding NCDs, subject to approvals. 
- The company says the refinancing will *ease interest burden*, improve cash flows and support growth; it operates an integrated steel plant and power unit at Vizianagaram (Vizag Profiles Group).

items.title: OpenAI partners Samsung, SK hynix to build AI data centres in South Korea
Aramco, Honeywell & KAUST partner on crude-to-chemicals tech
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Aramco, Honeywell UOP and KAUST signed a Joint Development Agreement to co-develop a next-generation direct *Crude-to-Chemicals (CTC)* process that converts crude oil directly into light olefins and other high-value chemicals.
- The partners aim to scale the CTC pathway to reduce capital and operating costs, improve *process economics*, boost energy efficiency and cut emissions.
- The initiative supports *Saudi Vision 2030* by advancing economic diversification, building national research capabilities and accelerating lab-to-commercial deployment.

items.title: Mahindra Logistics adds 4 lakh sq ft in Northeast
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *Mahindra Logistics* has added **over 4 lakh sq ft** of warehousing in the Northeast — 3 lakh sq ft in *Guwahati* and 1.3 lakh sq ft in *Agartala* — boosting regional distribution and cross‑border trade with Bangladesh.
- The Guwahati site is the region's largest Grade‑A multi‑client facility and hosts the first *Community Centre of Excellence* launched with the Logistics Skill Council to upskill local workers.
- Under its *Go‑East* strategy the firm has built 1 million sq ft in the Northeast, aims to reach 800+ pin codes, and expects 2,000+ jobs with 50% local hiring.

items.title: JK Tyre celebrates safety and sustainability milestones
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- JK Tyre reported *Five‑Star Safety Ratings* and the *Sword of Honour* from the British Safety Council across its manufacturing sites, underscoring strong health and safety performance.
- Its Chennai and Mysuru plants received the *Globe of Honour*, JK became the first Indian tyre maker to publish *Environmental Product Declarations* for three products, and the Chennai plant earned *ISCC Plus* certification.
- The company set Science‑Based Targets to cut carbon intensity by *50% by 2030* and achieve *carbon neutrality by 2050*, covering operations in India and Mexico.

items.title: L&T buildings & factories arm ₹5,000-₹10,000 crore order
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *L&T*'s Buildings & Factories vertical has won orders worth **₹5,000–₹10,000 crore** to build a 5.9 million sq ft IT park in Bengaluru and a separate mixed-use development in Mumbai.
- The Bengaluru project is a lumpsum turnkey job delivered in two phases with six 14‑storey towers and scope covering civil, façade, MEP, solar PV, STP, parking and targets *LEED* **Platinum** certification.
- The Mumbai mixed‑use project is to be completed within 45 months and the wins bolster *L&T*'s experience delivering large‑scale office and mixed‑use projects in India.

items.title: Nikkei rallies as Hitachi jumps on OpenAI report
items.summary:
- The *Nikkei* surged toward an all‑time high, up 1.6% as *chip* stocks drove the rally and the Topix gained 1.3%.
- *Hitachi* and Renesas jumped over 9% after local reports of a partnership with *OpenAI*, with Advantest, SoftBank and Tokyo Electron among top winners.
- A weaker *yen* and U.S. tech record highs supported exporters, though the upcoming LDP leadership vote adds short‑term political risk.

items.title: India's electronics manufacturing push gets massive boost: MeitY secy
India's National Critical Minerals Mission at P20
items.summary:
- At P20, Harivansh presented the seven‑year *National Critical Mineral Mission* (FY2024‑25–2030‑31) with ~Rs 16,300 crore and ~Rs 18,000 crore expected investments and 59 auctioned blocks.
- He urged building *resilient value chains*, diversifying supplies via partnerships (Africa, Latin America, Australia) and using training, technology and sustainable practices.
- He noted India's progress in *renewables* (3rd solar, 4th wind/overall), flagship schemes (PM Surya Ghar, PM‑KUSUM, PM JANMAN) and called for parliamentary oversight of climate finance.

items.title: China, Malaysia in talks for rare earths refinery project
Tata Power Renewable signs 80 MW hybrid PPA with Mumbai arm
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Tata Power Renewable Energy signed an 80 MW *firm and dispatchable renewable energy (FDRE)* PPA with Tata Power Mumbai Distribution for a hybrid *solar–wind–battery* project to be delivered within 24 months.
- The plant will supply four-hour peak power with *90% availability*, feed Mumbai’s network for about *800,000* customers, and generate roughly *315 million units* annually.
- It is expected to cut over *0.25 million tonnes CO2/year* and raises TPREL’s utility capacity to *11.3 GW* (including *9.4 GW* under PPAs and *5.6 GW* operational).

items.title: Japan's renewable curtailments on track to hit record as nuclear generation rises
Panel Recommends Solar Parks in Punjab Industrial Policy
items.summary:
- The Punjab panel urges a dedicated *land allocation policy* and development of *solar parks* with open access and flexible leasing to retain local industry investment.
- It recommends *capital subsidies*, a push for *local solar manufacturing*, higher rooftop caps for industry and seamless transfer of security deposits to accelerate deployment.
- Also proposed: *inter‑state power transfer* and 1–5 MW *canal‑based hydro* to tap Punjab's 5–6 GW potential and create rural jobs.

items.title: Piyush Goyal meets Airbus chairman to boost India aviation
items.summary:
- Union Minister Piyush Goyal met *Airbus* Chairman Rene Obermann to explore opportunities and encourage deeper *investment* and collaboration in India's aviation sector.

- The talks highlight India's appeal as an *aerospace* hub amid major recent orders, including Air India's 100-aircraft deal and IndiGo's historic 500 A320-family purchase.

- Airbus and Indian partners are expanding capacity and skills, notably a new *pilot training* centre in Gurugram to train 5,000 pilots, signaling long-term commitments.

items.title: Boeing 777X to be delayed to 2027: Reports
items.summary:
- Delivery of *Boeing*'s *777X* is now expected in early *2027*, Bloomberg reports, pushing first delivery back from 2026.
- Launch customer *Deutsche Lufthansa* is excluding the 777X from fleet plans until 2027 and analysts expect a $1–$4 billion charge for Boeing.
- CEO Kelly Ortberg said significant certification work remains; the program has already incurred over $10 billion in charges.

items.title: Global aircraft financiers flag issues with India's repossession draft rule
Tata Projects shifts gears, eyes next-gen manufacturing to chase high margins
Chipmakers add $200 billion in global rally
items.summary:
- Global chipmakers saw combined market cap rise by *$200 billion* as investors rushed into **AI** exposure, lifting indexes and shares such as **SK Hynix**, Samsung and ASML.
- The rally was driven by OpenAI's hefty valuation, its deals with South Korean firms and reports of Intel talks with AMD, stoking *FOMO* and pushing forward P/E to ~19–27x.
- Analysts caution that bubble talk remains and upcoming Q4 earnings may force a reality check despite current *momentum*.

items.title: Andhra CM: Boost indigenous manufacturing and consumption
items.summary:
- Andhra Pradesh CM N. Chandrababu Naidu urged a massive rise in *indigenous manufacturing* and *consumption* to protect culture and boost the economy.
- He highlighted local products like *kondapalli* and *yetikoppaka* toys, hand-woven fabrics and coconut goods, and pledged government support to rejuvenate crafts and improve branding.
- Naidu said Indians should aim to dictate terms globally, predicting India will be the *2nd-largest economy by 2038* and the top by 2047 while visiting a khadi market with PV Sindhu.

items.title: Trac Precision to supply parts for Coolbrook heaters
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Trac Precision Solutions (PTC Industries) will supply components for Coolbrook’s *RotoDynamic Heater (RDH)*, an electrified system reaching *1,700°C* for steel, cement and petrochemical plants.
- Initial order covers 2 milled blades and 4 cast vanes, scaling to *27,000 parts* yearly across 100 engines with projected revenues over *£10 million*; a second phase adds three more milled parts.
- PTC says the deal diversifies Trac into *industrial decarbonisation*, and Coolbrook calls it a milestone for scaling RDH to high‑volume industrial deployment.

items.title: ECMS: ₹1.15L-cr proposals, 1.41L jobs — Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Under the *ECMS*, the Centre received proposals totalling *₹1.15 lakh crore*, nearly double the scheme's envisaged *₹59,350 crore*.
- Applicants estimate production of over *₹10.34 lakh crore* (vs *₹4.56 lakh crore* target) and propose *1.41 lakh jobs*, exceeding the 91,600 goal.
- MeitY has begun fast‑tracking approvals; investments span *mobile/IT enclosures*, *HDI/flexible PCB* and *SMD passives*, boosting *domestic value addition* and export potential.

items.title: SKF India to invest ₹1,460 crore by 2030
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - The demerger creates two focused entities with combined planned investments of **₹1,460 crore** by 2030 and SKF India (Industrial) is expected to list by November 2025. - The *automotive* arm will invest *₹410–510 crore* to scale capacity in Haridwar, Pune and Bengaluru and capture trends like electrification, hybridisation and advanced safety. - The *industrial* arm will invest *₹800–950 crore* to expand channels, serve sectors such as railways and renewables, and build a new Pune facility by 2028.

items.title: US takes stake in company operating one of world's largest lithium mines in Nevada
Electronics component scheme draws ₹1.15L-cr proposals
items.summary:
- The **Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme** received *₹1.15 lakh crore* in investment proposals, well above its ~*₹59,000 crore* target.
- Submissions promise *1.41 lakh* jobs versus the scheme target of *91,600*, and applications for capital‑equipment segments remain open.
- Officials say the oversubscription signals strong industry interest and could accelerate domestic *electronics* production and supply‑chain growth.

items.title: Electronics Component Scheme draws ₹1.15L-cr, beats targets
items.summary:
- The *Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme* drew proposals totalling **₹1.15 lakh crore**, far exceeding the original ~₹59,000 crore projection.
- Officials expect the proposals to create *1.41 lakh jobs*, surpassing the scheme’s 91,600-job target and beating investment and production goals.
- The application window closed on Sept 30 for most segments, while the *capital equipment* window remains open, indicating ongoing investor interest in India’s electronics push.
